findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract modifies the state of variables without checking if their current value is the same as the one given as an argument, leading to redundant storage writes and unnecessary gas consumption.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RED - Redundant Event Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares certain events in its code. However, these events are not emitted within the contract's functions. As a result, these declared events are redundant and serve no purpose within the contract's current implementation.

findings.title: PAV - Pair Address Validation
findings.description: The `setAutomatedMarketMakerPair` function allows any user to set any arbitrary value without validation to the `automatedMarketMakerPairs` mapping, which is supposed to hold Uniswap pair addresses. This lack of validation can lead to unintended behavior, including the potential disruption of the contract's intended functionality.

findings.title: RC - Repetitive Calculations
findings.description: The contract contains methods with multiple occurrences of the same calculation being performed without utilizing a variable to store its result, leading to redundant code, hindering code readability, and increasing gas consumption.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments which can lead to issues like gas efficiency, complexity, readability, security, and maintainability of the source code.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity.

findings.title: RVD - Redundant Variable Declaration
findings.description: The contract declares certain variables that are not used in a meaningful way by the contract.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The code does not adhere to the Solidity style guide's naming conventions, which can negatively impact readability and maintainability.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can make a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and can also increase the size of the contract and the cost of deploying and interacting with it.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.
